text: Jonathan Tunick (born April 19, 1938) is an American orchestrator, musical director, and composer. He is one of sixteen people to have won all four major American show business awards: the Tony Awards, Academy Awards, Emmy Awards and Grammy Awards. He is best known for his work with Stephen Sondheim, starting in 1970 with Company.Rothstein, Mervyn. "A Life in the Theatre: Orchestrator, Composer and Music Director Jonathan Tunick" playbill.com, September 16, 2005 He was born in New York City. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:Living people Category:American composers Category:Musicians from New York City Category:Writers from New York City Category:Academy Award winning composers Category:Tony Award winners Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:Emmy Award winners
title: Jonathan Tunick
